thread.title: Students flip for men’s gymnastics performance at THON 2017 Pep Rally
thread.title_full: Students flip for men’s gymnastics performance at THON 2017 Pep Rally

author: Maddie Biertempfel and Julia Biertempfel | The Daily Collegian
title: Students flip for men’s gymnastics performance at THON 2017 Pep Rally
text:
Students flip for men’s gymnastics performance at THON 2017 Pep Rally Maddie Biertempfel and Julia Biertempfel | The Daily Collegian Feb 19, 2017 Buy Now Antonella Crescimbeni 
The men’s gymnastics team raise their hands in the air after winning the THON 2017 Pep Rally at the Bryce Jordan Center on Saturday, Feb. 18, 2017. 
Complete with Soulja Boy, the High School Musical classic "Breaking Free," and no shortage of acrobatic acumen, the men’s gymnastics team dominated the stage at the THON 2017 Pep Rally — earning the esteemed title of Pep Rally Champions. 
During parts of the performance, members of the team lifted one another while doing backflips and showing off their unparalleled break dancing skills. 
Some thought the gymnasts had an edge other teams simply couldn’t match. 
“I mean they have an unfair advantage, but they used it to their advantage and I think they did a really good job,” said Austin Smith, a member of A7, a special interest organization. 
Smith (junior-mathematics) added that the men’s soccer team was a close second, and he most enjoyed hearing the Disney throwbacks. 
Mark Maggitti, a member of Sigma Alpha Mu fraternity, agreed that the men’s gymnastics team “was definitely the best.” Related PHOTOS AND UPDATES: THON 2017 Athlete Pep Rally 
As the annual Athlete Pep Rally sends the crowd into a frenzy, here's the latest from inside the Bryce Jordan Center. 
“They had really good moves and their song choice was very good,” Maggitti (freshman-engineering) said. “'Soulja Boy,' yeah that was a good pick.” 
While both Smith and Maggitti thought men’s soccer would have won second, Alex Hartley wasn’t so sure. 
Hartley (senior-finance) of Alpha Phi, said while the gymnastics performance was “very impressive,” the women’s volleyball performance was her second favorite. 
Like Smith though, Hartley said she enjoyed hearing all the Disney songs, especially those from Mulan and Hercules. 
But the Hannah Montana songs were Carrie Zamonski’s favorite. Zamonski (sophomore-environmental resource management) said she loved seeing the all the hard work pay off for the teams performing. 
“They put so much effort into it,” Zamonski said. 
Richlande Louineus and her friends were taking a break while eating food in the concourse, but the Pep Rally helped their motivation. 
Louineus’ favorite part was when the men’s basketball team did a throwback to the Mannequin Challenge, a trend that swept the nation last semester. The use of “Breakin’ Free” from High School Musical and music from The Lizzy McGuire Movie were surprising additions. 
The football team’s performance was the undisputed favorite of Anusha Chauhry and Meghan Swonton, both of Alpha Omnicron Pi sorority. 
“I really liked the Disney theme,” Chaudhry (senior-security risk analysis) said. Although she felt a little sad that this is her last THON, the Pep Rally raised her spirits. +1 Buy Now Max Petrosky 
Meanwhile, Nicole Homanick got excited for the last day of THON by the men’s gymnastics team’s performance. 
“I really liked that they didn’t just make a dance routine,” Homanick (freshman-business) said, referring to the technical side of the performance. “The moves they did because of their gymnastic skill blew me away.”
